graph.original_query: I want to know the details of features for Mahindra XUV 3XO, use a single step for Retriever Agent but use multiple iterations in a single step to fetch detailed information and then create a report.

T001.initial_thoughts: I need to gather detailed information about the features of the Mahindra XUV 3XO. I'll use multiple web searches to cover different aspects like engine, safety, infotainment, and comfort. I'll consolidate all the information into a single JSON output.

code.CODE_1:
engine_results = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO engine specifications power torque', 6)
safety_results = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO safety features ratings airbags ABS', 6)
infotainment_results = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO infotainment system touchscreen features', 6)
comfort_results = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO comfort features seats space interior', 6)
other_results = search_web_with_text_content('Mahindra XUV 3XO specifications dimensions mileage', 6)

output = {
    'engine': engine_results,
    'safety': safety_results,
    'infotainment': infotainment_results,
    'comfort': comfort_results,
    'other_specs': other_results
}

The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. The XUV 3XO secured this accolade for both adult and child occupant protection, underlining Mahindras focus on providing world-class safety features in its vehicles. This latest recognition comes on the heels of Bharat NCAP's recent safety assessments of other prominent SUVs, including Tata models and the Citroen Basalt, as well as Mahindras own Thar Roxx and XUV 400 EV, both of which also earned 5-star ratings. The XUV 3XO demonstrated strong safety performance in multiple areas of testing. It achieved a remarkable total score of 29.36 out of 32 for adult occupant protection. In the frontal offset deformable barrier test, the SUV exhibited excellent protection for the co-driver, with good ratings across all body regions. However, the driver's chest, legs, and feet received ratings of adequate to marginal due to the impact forces recorded during the collision. Despite these minor deductions, protection to the driver's head, hip, and thigh was rated as good, reinforcing the XUV 3XOs overall structural integrity and crashworthiness. The XUV 3XO excelled in the side barrier and pole impact tests, securing a full 16 out of 16 points . These tests assess the SUVs ability to protect front-seat occupants in scenarios where side impacts pose a significant threat. Mahindras engineering expertise was evident, as the SUV delivered comprehensive protection to the head, chest, abdomen, and pelvis, showcasing its robust design and stringent safety standards. In terms of child occupant safety, the XUV 3XO also performed admirably, earning a total score of 43 out of 49 . While the SUV dropped a few points in the vehicle assessment score, it still received full marks in both the dynamic crash test and the child restraint system (CRS) parameters. The test evaluated the ability of child restraint systems to effectively secure young passengers during high-impact situations. The XUV 3XO accommodated CRS installations with ease, ensuring full protection for child passengers. Bharat NCAP tested both the fully loaded AX7 L variant and the entry-level MX2 variant of the XUV 3XO. The safety ratings are applicable across all variants, reflecting Mahindras commitment to offering consistent safety standards, regardless of trim level. The XUV 3XOs impressive safety performance is backed by a comprehensive suite of standard safety features. The SUV comes equipped with six airbags as a standard offering across all trims, ensuring superior protection for all occupants. Additionally, Electronic Stability Control (ESC) and Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) are standard, enhancing the vehicles stability and control in various driving conditions. Seat belt reminders are also provided for all seating positions, encouraging passengers to use seat belts at all times and thereby boosting overall safety. For customers opting for the higher-end variants, Mahindra offers Level 2 Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) . This package includes features such as adaptive cruise control, lane-keeping assist, and autonomous emergency braking, adding another layer of safety and convenience for drivers. These technologies are designed to mitigate the risk of collisions and assist drivers in maintaining optimal control over the vehicle. The XUV 3XOs success in the Bharat NCAP crash tests is a testament to Mahindras dedication to vehicle safety. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. infotainment.text: [{'url': 'https://ackodrive.com/car-guide/mahindra-xuv-3xo-features-explained/', 'content': 'HOME BUY NEW CAR BLOG Home / Articles / Car Guide / Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. output.formatted_report_T002:
📊 Mahindra XUV 3XO Analysis Report

🎯 Executive Summary

This report provides a comprehensive overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features such as engine specifications, safety measures, infotainment system, and comfort enhancements. The analysis is based on data extracted from various web sources to provide a detailed and structured presentation.

Engine Specifications

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with multiple engine options:

  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol: Available with 6-speed MT Manual and 6-speed TC Automatic transmission, producing 111PS of power at 5000rpm and 200Nm of torque between 1500rpm and 3750rpm.
  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol (131PS): Comes with a 6-speed MT Manual and a 6-speed TC Automatic transmission, delivering 131PS of power at 5000rpm and 230Nm of torque between 1500rpm and 3750rpm.
  • 1.5L Turbo Diesel: Equipped with a 6-speed MT Manual and a 6-speed AMT Automatic transmission, rated to deliver 117PS of power at 3750rpm and 300Nm of torque between 1500rpm and 2500rpm.

Engine Options:

  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol with 6-speed MT (7 variants)
  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol with 6-speed TC (4 variants)
  • 1.5L Turbo Diesel with 6-speed MT (7 variants)
  • 1.5L Turbo Diesel with 6-speed AMT (3 variants)
  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol with 6-speed MT (4 variants)
  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol with 6-speed TC (4 variants)

Safety Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests, demonstrating high levels of safety for both adult and child occupants [1]. Key safety features include:

  • Airbags: Equipped with six airbags as standard across all trims.
  • Electronic Stability Control (ESC): Enhances vehicle stability and control.
  • Anti-lock Braking System (ABS): Improves braking efficiency.
  • Seat Belt Reminders: Available for all seating positions.
  • Level 2 ADAS: Higher-end variants offer features like adaptive cruise control, lane-keeping assist, and autonomous emergency braking.

Infotainment System

The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a smart infotainment system with:

  • High-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation.
  • Built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment and control.
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system.
  • Wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay connectivity.
  • ADRENOX Connect technology for remote control of car features via smartphone.

Comfort Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a comfortable driving experience with features like:

  • Skyroof
  • Soft-touch leatherette on door trims and dashboard
  • Premium leatherette seats
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination
  • Passive keyless entry
  • Front armrest with storage
  • Console with cup holder

Dimensions and Capacity

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has the following dimensions and capacity:

  • Length: 3990 mm
  • Width: 1821 mm
  • Height: 1647 mm
  • Wheelbase: 2600 mm
  • Boot Space: 364 Litres
  • Fuel Tank Capacity: 42 Litres
  • Seating Capacity: 5

Mileage

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a mileage of 17.96 to 20.6 kmpl, depending on the variant and fuel type [2].

Variants

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants, including MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro, AX5, AX5 L, AX7, and AX7 L. Each variant offers a different set of features and engine options.

Additional Features

  • Power Steering: Yes
  • Power Windows: Front and Rear
  • Automatic Climate Control: Yes
  • Alloy Wheels: Yes
  • Multi-function Steering Wheel: Yes

Suspension, Steering & Brakes

  • Front Suspension: MacPherson Strut suspension
  • Rear Suspension: Rear twist beam
  • Steering Type: Electric
  • Front Brake Type: Disc
  • Rear Brake Type: Disc

Fuel & Performance

  • Fuel Type: Petrol and Diesel
  • Fuel Tank Capacity: 42 Litres
  • Emission Norm Compliance: BS VI 2.0

Exterior Dimensions

  • Length: 3990 mm
  • Width: 1821 mm
  • Height: 1647 mm
  • Wheelbase: 2600 mm

Competitive Advantage

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other sub-compact SUVs like Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, and Maruti Suzuki Brezza. It stands out due to its strong safety ratings, powerful engine options, and advanced features like Level 2 ADAS and a panoramic sunroof [3].

Source Citations

  1. Mahindra XUV 3XO Safety Ratings: Global / Bharat NCAP - carndbike
  2. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications - Dimensions, Configurations, Features, Engine cc
  3. Mahindra XUV 3XO

Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. In this blo", 'images': [{'url': 'https://www.newznew.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/XUV-3XOs-Safety-Features.webp', 'alt_text': "XUV 3XO's Safety Features", 'width': '1599', 'height': '900', 'class': 'aligncenter size-full wp-image-112693', 'confidence': 0.9999999999999999}], 'rank': 1}, {'url': 'https://www.carandbike.com/mahindra-cars/xuv-3xo/safety-rating', 'content': "Mahindra XUV 3XO Safety Ratings: Global / Bharat NCAP - carndbike Bharat Ncap Crash Test Mahindra XUV 3XO XUV 3XO Safety Rating Mileage Price Specs Features Colors Images News Reviews FAQs EMI Mahindra XUV 3XO Safety Rating 5 29.36 / 32.00 Adult 5 43.00/ 49.00 Child Tested By Bharat Ncap Adult 5 Child 5 Body Type SUV (2 rows) Year of Testing 2024 Crash Test Weight 1737 Mahindras sub-compact SUV, the XUV 3XO, has set a new benchmark in vehicle safety by earning a 5-star rating in Bharat NCAPs crash tests. The XUV 3XO secured this accolade for both adult and child occupant protection, underlining Mahindras focus on providing world-class safety features in its vehicles. This latest recognition comes on the heels of Bharat NCAP's recent safety assessments of other prominent SUVs, including Tata models and the Citroen Basalt, as well as Mahindras own Thar Roxx and XUV 400 EV, both of which also earned 5-star ratings. The XUV 3XO demonstrated strong safety performance in multiple areas of testing. It achieved a remarkable total score of 29.36 out of 32 for adult occupant protection. In the frontal offset deformable barrier test, the SUV exhibited excellent protection for the co-driver, with good ratings across all body regions. However, the driver's chest, legs, and feet received ratings of adequate to marginal due to the impact forces recorded during the collision. Despite these minor deductions, protection to the driver's head, hip, and thigh was rated as good, reinforcing the XUV 3XOs overall structural integrity and crashworthiness. The XUV 3XO excelled in the side barrier and pole impact tests, securing a full 16 out of 16 points . These tests assess the SUVs ability to protect front-seat occupants in scenarios where side impacts pose a significant threat. Mahindras engineering expertise was evident, as the SUV delivered comprehensive protection to the head, chest, abdomen, and pelvis, showcasing its robust design and stringent safety standards. In terms of child occupant safety, the XUV 3XO also performed admirably, earning a total score of 43 out of 49 . While the SUV dropped a few points in the vehicle assessment score, it still received full marks in both the dynamic crash test and the child restraint system (CRS) parameters. The test evaluated the ability of child restraint systems to effectively secure young passengers during high-impact situations. The XUV 3XO accommodated CRS installations with ease, ensuring full protection for child passengers. Bharat NCAP tested both the fully loaded AX7 L variant and the entry-level MX2 variant of the XUV 3XO. The safety ratings are applicable across all variants, reflecting Mahindras commitment to offering consistent safety standards, regardless of trim level. The XUV 3XOs impressive safety performance is backed by a comprehensive suite of standard safety features. The SUV comes equipped with six airbags as a standard offering across all trims, ensuring superior protection for all occupants. Additionally, Electronic Stability Control (ESC) and Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) are standard, enhancing the vehicles stability and control in various driving conditions. Seat belt reminders are also provided for all seating positions, encouraging passengers to use seat belts at all times and thereby boosting overall safety. For customers opting for the higher-end variants, Mahindra offers Level 2 Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) . This package includes features such as adaptive cruise control, lane-keeping assist, and autonomous emergency braking, adding another layer of safety and convenience for drivers. These technologies are designed to mitigate the risk of collisions and assist drivers in maintaining optimal control over the vehicle. The XUV 3XOs success in the Bharat NCAP crash tests is a testament to Mahindras dedication to vehicle safety. Team Spinny Last updated 3 months ago As we all know the safety of a vehicle is one of the most important attributes in current times. People want a car that not only delivers on performance and efficiency but also stands out with its safety features. The Mahindra XUV 3XO is making headlines as one of the safest small SUVs in India. This beast by Mahindra has gained attention for its advanced features and design, which are further complemented with its safety features. It is an upgraded version of the Mahindra XUV300 that packs a strong punch. The starting price of the Mahindra XUV 3XO is Rs. 7.99 lakh (ex-showroom), making it an affordable yet well-equipped compact SUV. The safety of a vehicle is best measured through crash test ratings, and Mahindra has ensured that the XUV 3XO meets high standards. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating proves that it is one of the safest cars in its segment. Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP Safety Rating Checking a cars NCAP rating is one of the best ways to understand how safe it is. NCAP, or the New Car Assessment Program, conducts crash tests to see how well a vehicle can protect its occupants in an accident. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has performed well in its NCAP tests. It was tested under Bharat NCAP (BNCAP), which is Indias version of the global safety program. The Mahindra XUV 3XO received a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP, meaning it provides excellent protection for both adults and children. Lets look at the details of the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP rating. Mahindra XUV 3XO Adult Occupant Protection Rating During the adult occupants rating in the NCAP test, the Mahindra XUV 3XO NCAP ratings were pretty impressive. The vehicle scored the maximum possible score of 29.36 out of 32 points . Some crucial factors that contributed to this high rating include: Stable Bodyshell: The structure of the Mahindra XUV 3XO has been found to be stable, meaning it can withstand additional impact without collapsing. Frontal Impact Protection: The cars front airbags and seatbelt pre-tensioners helped reduce injuries to the head, neck, and chest. Side Impact Protection: The side structure of the XUV 3XO, along with additional side and curtain airbags, ensured safety in side collisions. Electronic Stability Control (ESC): This system helps maintain control of the car during sudden turns or slippery conditions, reducing the chances of rollovers. All-Wheel Disc Brakes: The XUV 3XO offers disc brakes on all four wheels, providing better braking efficiency. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Some of the key factors that contributed to this rating include: ISOFIX Child Seat Anchors: These allow parents to securely install child safety seats, reducing the risk of movement in case of impact. Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. Its bookings will open on May 15 with deliveries to commence from May 26. The Mahindra 3XO is available in 9 broad variants: MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro, AX5, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. Lets take a look at each of these variants and what features it offers: 3XO MX1 Engine: 1.2-litre turbo-petrol Price: Rs 7.49 lakh The base-spec MX1 variant offers these features: Exterior Interior Infotainment Comfort & Convenience Safety Projector halogen headlights LED turn indicators on ORVM LED tail lights 16-inch steel wheels Fabric upholstery Adjustable headrest for 2nd row None Front armrest with storage 60:40 rear seat split Electrically adjustable ORVMs Manual AC Rear AC vents All power windows 12V socket Front USB type-A port and rear USB type-C port 6 airbags Electronic stability control All-wheel disc brakes ISOFIX child seat anchors Reverse parking sensors Seatbelt reminders for all passengers 3-point seatbelts for all passengers Being a base variant, it gets the basic design elements and misses out on an infotainment system which the one-above base variant gets. That being said, it is still well-equipped in terms of convenience and safety kit. The base variant is only powered by the 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine paired with a 6-speed manual transmission. XUV 3XO MX2 Engine: 1.5-litre diesel Price: Rs 9.99 lakh The one-above-base MX2 variant offers these features: Exterior Interior Infotainment Comfort & Convenience Safety Follow me home headlamps 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system 4-speaker sound system Steering mounted audio controls Keyless entry A noteworthy addition is the 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system along with additional comfort features. From this variant onwards, you get the option of a 1.5-litre diesel engine. 3XO MX2 Pro Engine: 1.2-litre turbo-petrol, 1.5-litre diesel Price: Rs 8.99 lakh to Rs 10.39 lakh This is what the MX2 Pro variant offers over the MX2 variant: Exterior Interior Infotainment Comfort & Convenience Safety Wheel covers Single pane sunroof The MX2 Pro variant is based on the MX2 variant, however, it additionally gets a single-pane sunroof. This variant is also an entry point to the automatic variants, equipped with a 6-speed automatic transmission which is paired with a 1.2-litre turbo-petrol engine. 3XO MX3 Engine: 1.2-litre turbo-petrol, 1.5-litre diesel Price: Rs 10.99 lakh to Rs 11.69 lakh The MX3 variant being these additional features over the MX2 Pro variant: Exterior Interior Infotainment Comfort & Convenience Safety Wireless Android Auto Wired Apple CarPlay HD display for the 10.25-inch touchscreen Wireless phone charger Cruise control With the MX3 variant, you get an improved infotainment system and a couple of added features for comfort and convenience. It is powered by either a turbo-petrol or a diesel engine. A 6-speed AMT is offered with the diesel engine. 3XO MX3 Pro Engine: 1.2-litre turbo-petrol, 1.5-litre diesel Price: Rs 9.99 lakh to Rs 11.49 lakh Over the MX3, the MX3 Pro gets these additional December 30th, 2024 No Comments Home BLOG Explore Top Features of Mahindra XUV 3XO Explore Top Features of Mahindra XUV 3XO All Variants Explained Bookings for the Mahindra XUV 3XO began on May 15 in India, while deliveries got initiated from May 26. Not only does the Compact SUV come with Everything You Want & More, but it also has a significantly updated look. Since the Mahindra XUV 300s powertrain configuration is the same as that of the small SUV, there are no changes to its technical specifications. The SUVs front profile appears more forceful thanks to its redesigned radiator grille, new projector headlights, and inverted LED daytime running lights. The Hyundai Venue, Maruti Suzuki Brezza, and Tata Nexon are among the best-selling cars in the segment that the car will go up against. Pay a minimum of Rs 21,000* at the Automotive showrooms like Mahindra 3XO Showroom in Hyderabad to book the compact SUV now. The fact that the official statistics show an astounding 50,000 BOOKINGS IN 60 MINUTES is exciting. Ex-showroom, the SUVs price ranges from Rs 7.48* Lakh to Rs 15.49* Lakh. Overview of Top Features This car is amazing with its 10.25-inch infotainment system and driver display, digital instrument cluster, ambient lighting, wireless charging, dual-zone climate control, Adrenox, ventilated front seats, and powered driver seats. It also has a 360-degree surround camera. Along with Apple CarPlay, a Type-C charging port, wireless Android Auto setup, and many other car connection features, it also has these features. Level-2 ADAS, panoramic sunroof category first introduced with the Mahindra 3XO. Also, theres a replacement of the XUV300 Variants with the labels MX and AX in 3XO. The major upgrades in Mahindra XUV 3XO are set to make the driving experience, comfort, safety, and technology more advanced. Safety There are six airbags as standard on all models of car. It also has a rear disc brake, an ISOFIX anchor, and electronic stability control. A level 2 advanced driver assistance system is among the safety systems that are included with the top 3XO model. A 360-degree camera, hill-start assistance, blind spot monitoring, and an electronic parking brake with auto hold are among the other safety features. Talk to the expert staff of Automotive Mahindra Dealers Hyderabad to know more information on safety. Engine There are three different engine options available for the vehicle. A 1.5-liter diesel engine with 115 horsepower is produced. A 1.2-liter gasoline engine with turbocharging generates 110 horsepower, while another 1.2-liter engine with turbocharging generates 129 horsepower. Additionally, a 6-speed manual or automatic transmission is an option with this. The XUV 3XO boasts a wide variety of premium turbo engines designed for exhilarating performance and outstanding efficiency. In keeping with the brands tradition of delivering thrilling performance, the mStallion TGDi and Turbo Diesel engines produce best-in-class power and torque of 96 kW (130 PS) & 230 Nm and 85.8 kW (117 PS) & 300 Nm, respectively. The mStallion TGDi can accelerate from 0 to 60 km/h in 4.5 seconds and has a segment-best fuel efficiency of 20.1 km/l* with a manual gearbox. A 6-speed AISIN 3rd Gen Automatic Transmission, which is well-known for its dependability and durability, powers the Mahindra XUV 3XO. This is proved by the fact that it was effectively adopted by the XUV 700, which also utilizes a transmission from the same family. Updated on May 02, 2024 05:35:55 PM 87,036 Views Follow us on The XUV 3XO's styling is big on flash The diamond-shaped detailing on the lights and grille are a nice touch. The infotainment is now a 10.25-inch unit and works well. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. The 2,600mm wheelbase remains class best, but the short overhangs, particularly at the back, tell you that this is a vehicle that's brutally shortened (remember it started life as a SsangYong Tivoli) to get length under the critical 4m mark, needed to qualify as a small car and hence a lower rate of tax. New 17-inch alloys are the largest in the segment. The XUV 3XO gets two petrol and one diesel engine option. The entry-level XUV 3XO gets a 1.2-liter turbo MPFI petrol engine while the higher variants come with a 1.2-liter turbo direct injection petrol. Additionally, there is a 1.5-liter diesel engine on offer on the XUV 3XO as well. Mahindra XUV 3XO on road price starts from Rs 8.50 lakh going upto Rs 17.84 lakh for the top model diesel automatic variant. The more powerful petrol engine on offer on the XUV 3XO is the 1.2 TGDI version that churns out a healthy 130hp and 230Nm. It can be opted with either a six-speed manual or a six-speed automatic. Mahindra XUV 3XO mileage for the 1.2 TGDI petrol ranges from 20.1kpl for the manual and 18.2kpl for the automatic. This engine is available on the XUV 3XO AX5 L, the AX7 and the AX7 L variants. 5-star Bharat NCAP Safety Rating Compact SUV of the Year: Autocar Awards 2025 Mahindra XUV 3XO key specifications The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a choice of three engines: 1.2L turbo petrol with 110 PS, 1.2L TGDi turbo petrol with 130 PS, and 1.5L diesel with 117 PS, paired with manual, AMT, and 6-speed torque converter options. It features a spacious 385-litre boot, a 10.25-inch touchscreen, and a panoramic sunroof which is the widest in the segment. With over 60 connected car features and Level 2 ADAS, it is a tech-loaded compact SUV. In this blo", 'images': [{'url': 'https://www.newznew.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/XUV-3XOs-Safety-Features.webp', 'alt_text': "XUV 3XO's Safety Features", 'width': '1599', 'height': '900', 'class': 'aligncenter size-full wp-image-112693', 'confidence': 0.9999999999999999}], 'rank': 1}, {'url': 'https://www.carandbike.com/mahindra-cars/xuv-3xo/safety-rating', 'content': "Mahindra XUV 3XO Safety Ratings: Global / Bharat NCAP - carndbike Bharat Ncap Crash Test Mahindra XUV 3XO XUV 3XO Safety Rating Mileage Price Specs Features Colors Images News Reviews FAQs EMI Mahindra XUV 3XO Safety Rating 5 29.36 / 32.00 Adult 5 43.00/ 49.00 Child Tested By Bharat Ncap Adult 5 Child 5 Body Type SUV (2 rows) Year of Testing 2024 Crash Test Weight 1737 Mahindras sub-compact SUV, the XUV 3XO, has set a new benchmark in vehicle safety by earning a 5-star rating in Bharat NCAPs crash tests. The XUV 3XO secured this accolade for both adult and child occupant protection, underlining Mahindras focus on providing world-class safety features in its vehicles. This latest recognition comes on the heels of Bharat NCAP's recent safety assessments of other prominent SUVs, including Tata models and the Citroen Basalt, as well as Mahindras own Thar Roxx and XUV 400 EV, both of which also earned 5-star ratings. The XUV 3XO demonstrated strong safety performance in multiple areas of testing. It achieved a remarkable total score of 29.36 out of 32 for adult occupant protection. In the frontal offset deformable barrier test, the SUV exhibited excellent protection for the co-driver, with good ratings across all body regions. However, the driver's chest, legs, and feet received ratings of adequate to marginal due to the impact forces recorded during the collision. Despite these minor deductions, protection to the driver's head, hip, and thigh was rated as good, reinforcing the XUV 3XOs overall structural integrity and crashworthiness. The XUV 3XO excelled in the side barrier and pole impact tests, securing a full 16 out of 16 points . These tests assess the SUVs ability to protect front-seat occupants in scenarios where side impacts pose a significant threat. Mahindras engineering expertise was evident, as the SUV delivered comprehensive protection to the head, chest, abdomen, and pelvis, showcasing its robust design and stringent safety standards. In terms of child occupant safety, the XUV 3XO also performed admirably, earning a total score of 43 out of 49 . While the SUV dropped a few points in the vehicle assessment score, it still received full marks in both the dynamic crash test and the child restraint system (CRS) parameters. The test evaluated the ability of child restraint systems to effectively secure young passengers during high-impact situations. The XUV 3XO accommodated CRS installations with ease, ensuring full protection for child passengers. Bharat NCAP tested both the fully loaded AX7 L variant and the entry-level MX2 variant of the XUV 3XO. The safety ratings are applicable across all variants, reflecting Mahindras commitment to offering consistent safety standards, regardless of trim level. The XUV 3XOs impressive safety performance is backed by a comprehensive suite of standard safety features. The SUV comes equipped with six airbags as a standard offering across all trims, ensuring superior protection for all occupants. Additionally, Electronic Stability Control (ESC) and Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) are standard, enhancing the vehicles stability and control in various driving conditions. Seat belt reminders are also provided for all seating positions, encouraging passengers to use seat belts at all times and thereby boosting overall safety. For customers opting for the higher-end variants, Mahindra offers Level 2 Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) . This package includes features such as adaptive cruise control, lane-keeping assist, and autonomous emergency braking, adding another layer of safety and convenience for drivers. These technologies are designed to mitigate the risk of collisions and assist drivers in maintaining optimal control over the vehicle. The XUV 3XOs success in the Bharat NCAP crash tests is a testament to Mahindras dedication to vehicle safety. Mahindra XUV 3XO Child Occupant Protection Rating Child safety is another critical aspect of a cars overall safety rating. The Mahindra XUV 3XO safety rating for child occupants is 43 out of 49 points , which is an excellent score. This means the car provides solid protection for children in case of an accident. Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result Home Car News Bike News EV News Comparisons Featured About Privacy No Result View All Result No Result View All Result What is Mahindra XUV3XOs Safety Rating? by Harsh Kashyap 1 year ago in Featured A A A A Reset Mahindra XUV300 Global NCAP Safety Rating The next topic in this series is Mahindra XUV3XO safety rating. The XUV3XO is the facelift version of the XUV300. Note that the latter has already received a full 5-star rating at the Global NCAP back in 2020. That is what we will base our post on. XUV3XO belongs to one of the most popular market segments in the country. There are tons of compact SUVs in this space including the likes of the Hyundai Venue, Kia Sonet, Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza and more. Therefore, it is not easy to dominate the competition. As a result, Mahindra offers some of the best-in-segment features to woo the customers. Its safety, striking looks and multiple powertrain options are its strengths. For now, let us take a look at the details of this case. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating In 2020, the Mahindra XUV300 scored 5 stars in the Adult Occupant Protection (AOP) and 4 stars in Child Occupant Protection (COP). Mahindra has always focused on ensuring that its vehicles possess the latest safety equipment. In fact, it was the first SUV in its class to offer 7 airbags. Later, one airbag was removed to control costs. This XUV300 featured ISOFIX child seat mounts, 4-channel ABS, Seatbelt Reminder, Front Seatbelt Pretensioners and dual-airbags (since the base model is tested). Therefore, even the base model was well-kitted when it comes to safety amenities. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Adult Safety In the AOP category, the XUV3XO secured an almost perfect 16.42 points out of a possible 17. In the crash test, the drivers head displayed good protection, while his chest showed adequate protection. Furthermore, the drivers knees demonstrated good protection and his tibias offered adequate and good protection. Finally, the drivers feet had adequate protection. On the other hand, the passengers head and neck experienced good protection along with the chest. Moreover, the passengers knees and tibias were able to get good protection as well. The bodyshell of the SUV was rated as stable and it was capable of withstanding further loadings. Also, the footwell area was rated as stable. For the Side Impact Regulation UN95, the car met the technical requirements as standard. All these factors contributed to the 5-star safety rating for adult protection. Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Rating Child Safety For the COP section, the child seats were installed for an 18-month-old and a 3-year-old occupant. For the latter, the seat was installed forward-facing with ISOFIX and top tether. It was able to prevent excessive forward movement during the impact. As a result, fair protection was available for the chest. For the younger child, the CRS (Child Restraint System) was installed with ISOFIX and support leg. In this configuration, the protection was good. Furthermore, the recommended CRSs did not show incompatibility. This model didnt offer 3-point seatbelts in all seating positions. The ISOFIX and top tether anchorages were standard in 2 outboard rear seats. Also, the SUV offers the passenger airbag disconnection switch in case a rearward-facing CRS needs to be installed in the front passenger seat. All these aspects ensured a decent 4-star safety rating. At the time, it bagged the highest combined points for any vehicle in India. That is a testament to the fact that it was ahead of the competition since the beginning. Also Read: What is Maruti WagonR Safety Rating by Global NCAP? Mahindra XUV3XO Safety Features Now while these tests were conducted on the pre-facelift model, the current version comes with additional safety tech and amenities. Mahindra XUV 3XO Features Explained: A Comprehensive Guide. Published on 27 Aug, 2024, 9:41 AM IST Updated on 28 Aug, 2024, 5:59 AM IST Team Ackodrive 8 min read Interesting Articles Follow us on Share Post Mahindra recently launched the much-awaited Mahindra XUV 3XO as a compact SUV in the Indian automotive industry. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. Hence, we have prepared a table for you highlighting the ex-showroom price of each XUV 3XO variant: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variant Ex-Showroom Price MX1 Rs. 7.49 Lakhs MX2 Rs. 9.99 Lakhs MX2 PRO Rs. 8.99 Lakhs to Rs. 10.39 Lakhs MX3 Rs. 9.49 Lakhs to Rs. 11.68 Lakhs MX3 PRO Rs. 9.99 Lakhs to Rs. 11.49 Lakhs AX5 Rs. 10.69 Lakhs to Rs. 12.88 Lakhs AX5 Luxury Rs. 11.99 Lakhs to Rs. 13.49 Lakhs AX7 Rs. 12.49 Lakhs to Rs. 14.49 Lakhs AX7 Luxury Rs. 13.99 Lakhs to Rs. 15.49 Lakhs Note : The prices of the Mahindra XUV 3XO variants can change without any prior notice. So, before booking your car, talk with your nearest dealer to know the latest price. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants Unlatch Elated Driving Experience with the All New Mahindra XUV 3XO Making its presence felt in the Indian compact SUV market, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is one of the best cars in this segment manufactured by Mahindra. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. In addition, the sound system lets you experience sonic expanse, and the bass enhancer technology uplifts your mood while driving in crowded areas. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a high-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation and has built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment. Its bookings will open on May 15 with deliveries to commence from May 26. The Mahindra 3XO is available in 9 broad variants: MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro, AX5, AX5 L, AX7 and AX7 L. Lets take a look at each of these variants and what features it offers: 3XO MX1 Engine: 1.2-litre turbo-petrol Price: Rs 7.49 lakh The base-spec MX1 variant offers these features: Exterior Interior Infotainment Comfort & Convenience Safety Projector halogen headlights LED turn indicators on ORVM LED tail lights 16-inch steel wheels Fabric upholstery Adjustable headrest for 2nd row None Front armrest with storage 60:40 rear seat split Electrically adjustable ORVMs Manual AC Rear AC vents All power windows 12V socket Front USB type-A port and rear USB type-C port 6 airbags Electronic stability control All-wheel disc brakes ISOFIX child seat anchors Reverse parking sensors Seatbelt reminders for all passengers 3-point seatbelts for all passengers Being a base variant, it gets the basic design elements and misses out on an infotainment system which the one-above base variant gets. By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. Outperforming its rivals, the Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue and Maruti Suzuki Brezza, the Mahindra XUV 3XO brings a fresh look to the segment. With the latest updates and comfortable features, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is on the list of must-buy compact SUVs in India. Here, we will take a closer look at the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained and help you choose the ideal car. Contents Price of Mahindra XUV 3XO Variants After the Mahindra XUV 3XO features are explained, you must know the price of each variant. It offers more convenience and comfort when driving on different terrains. The following are detailed discussions of the Mahindra XUV 3XO tech specs and features: 1. Influencing Exterior Look The Mahindra XUV 3XO has a specific design to turn heads with its athletic stance. It commands respect and exudes the confidence of a true SUV. The all-new Mahindra XUV 3XO has an ample ground clearance of 201 mm, making it easy for you to drive on rocky terrains. In addition, the XUV 3XO comes with a command seating position to offer an exhilarating driving experience. The Mahindra XUV 3XO has LED DRLs and headlamps that will lead the road to envy you whenever you turn them on. Furthermore, the infinity tail lamps add an X factor to your style quotient. The car also features 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels for that sporty look. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Dimensions 2. Comforting Interior When you drive the Mahindra XUV 3XO, it elevates your every journey. Stepping inside the XUV 3XOs cabin will let you discover a sanctuary of sophistication and comfort. It is one of the key parts of the Mahindra XUV 3XO features explained, as it has a meticulous design for the finest SUV lovers. The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a Skyroof and soft-touch leatherette on the door trims and dashboard. Furthermore, the car has premium leatherette seats, a cooled glovebox with illumination, and a passive keyless entry. It also features a front armrest with storage and a console with a cup holder for a comfortable drive. Check out: Mahindra XUV 3XO Interior 3. Smart Connectivity Another key Mahindra XUV 3XO configuration is its smart connectivity and technology. The car comes with a Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system to make your drive enjoyable. 📊 Mahindra XUV 3XO Analysis Report

🎯 Executive Summary

This report provides a comprehensive overview of the Mahindra XUV 3XO, covering its key features such as engine specifications, safety measures, infotainment system, and comfort enhancements. The analysis is based on data extracted from various web sources to provide a detailed and structured presentation.

Engine Specifications

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available with multiple engine options:

  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol: Available with 6-speed MT Manual and 6-speed TC Automatic transmission, producing 111PS of power at 5000rpm and 200Nm of torque between 1500rpm and 3750rpm.
  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol (131PS): Comes with a 6-speed MT Manual and a 6-speed TC Automatic transmission, delivering 131PS of power at 5000rpm and 230Nm of torque between 1500rpm and 3750rpm.
  • 1.5L Turbo Diesel: Equipped with a 6-speed MT Manual and a 6-speed AMT Automatic transmission, rated to deliver 117PS of power at 3750rpm and 300Nm of torque between 1500rpm and 2500rpm.

Engine Options:

  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol with 6-speed MT (7 variants)
  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol with 6-speed TC (4 variants)
  • 1.5L Turbo Diesel with 6-speed MT (7 variants)
  • 1.5L Turbo Diesel with 6-speed AMT (3 variants)
  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol with 6-speed MT (4 variants)
  • 1.2L Turbo Petrol with 6-speed TC (4 variants)

Safety Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has achieved a 5-star safety rating in Bharat NCAP crash tests, demonstrating high levels of safety for both adult and child occupants [1]. Key safety features include:

  • Airbags: Equipped with six airbags as standard across all trims.
  • Electronic Stability Control (ESC): Enhances vehicle stability and control.
  • Anti-lock Braking System (ABS): Improves braking efficiency.
  • Seat Belt Reminders: Available for all seating positions.
  • Level 2 ADAS: Higher-end variants offer features like adaptive cruise control, lane-keeping assist, and autonomous emergency braking.

Infotainment System

The Mahindra XUV 3XO features a smart infotainment system with:

  • High-definition touchscreen system for infotainment and navigation.
  • Built-in Amazon Alexa for entertainment and control.
  • Harman Kardon 7-speaker audio system.
  • Wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay connectivity.
  • ADRENOX Connect technology for remote control of car features via smartphone.

Comfort Features

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is designed to offer a comfortable driving experience with features like:

  • Skyroof
  • Soft-touch leatherette on door trims and dashboard
  • Premium leatherette seats
  • Cooled glovebox with illumination
  • Passive keyless entry
  • Front armrest with storage
  • Console with cup holder

Dimensions and Capacity

The Mahindra XUV 3XO has the following dimensions and capacity:

  • Length: 3990 mm
  • Width: 1821 mm
  • Height: 1647 mm
  • Wheelbase: 2600 mm
  • Boot Space: 364 Litres
  • Fuel Tank Capacity: 42 Litres
  • Seating Capacity: 5

Mileage

The Mahindra XUV 3XO offers a mileage of 17.96 to 20.6 kmpl, depending on the variant and fuel type [2].

Variants

The Mahindra XUV 3XO is available in multiple variants, including MX1, MX2, MX2 Pro, MX3, MX3 Pro, AX5, AX5 L, AX7, and AX7 L. Each variant offers a different set of features and engine options.

Additional Features

  • Power Steering: Yes
  • Power Windows: Front and Rear
  • Automatic Climate Control: Yes
  • Alloy Wheels: Yes
  • Multi-function Steering Wheel: Yes

Suspension, Steering & Brakes

  • Front Suspension: MacPherson Strut suspension
  • Rear Suspension: Rear twist beam
  • Steering Type: Electric
  • Front Brake Type: Disc
  • Rear Brake Type: Disc

Fuel & Performance

  • Fuel Type: Petrol and Diesel
  • Fuel Tank Capacity: 42 Litres
  • Emission Norm Compliance: BS VI 2.0

Exterior Dimensions

  • Length: 3990 mm
  • Width: 1821 mm
  • Height: 1647 mm
  • Wheelbase: 2600 mm

Competitive Advantage

The Mahindra XUV 3XO competes with other sub-compact SUVs like Tata Nexon, Hyundai Venue, and Maruti Suzuki Brezza. It stands out due to its strong safety ratings, powerful engine options, and advanced features like Level 2 ADAS and a panoramic sunroof [3].

  2. Mahindra XUV 3XO Specifications - Dimensions, Configurations, Features, Engine cc
